metadata.title: Adding a background to your view

inlineContent.text: You can add a view as a background with the
view modifier.
To add a background under multiple views, or to have a background larger than an existing view,
you can layer the views by placing them within a
, and place the view you want to be
in the background at the bottom of the view stack.
You can specify that a background view should ignore the safe area insets to extend the background to some or all edges.
If your design calls for a background, you can use the
modifier to add it underneath an existing view.

content.text: Extend the background into the safe areas

inlineContent.text: By default, SwiftUI sizes and positions views to avoid system defined safe areas to ensure that system content or the edges of the device won’t obstruct your views.
If your design calls for the background to extend to the screen edges, use the
modifier to override the default.
The background gradient fills the display area of the device and ignores the safe area insets.

content.text: Adjust views when displaying the keyboard

inlineContent.text: You can ignore the keyboard’s safe area by adding the
modifier.
When you activate the keyboard, the content of the vertical stack remains fixed, ignoring the space used by the keyboard:
To get the contents of the vertical stack to respect the safe areas and adjust to the keyboard, move the modifier to only apply to the background view.
To accommodate the keyboard, SwiftUI resizes and positions your view.
Because the background view has the
modifier, it remains unchanged.
